https://www.thetimes.com/sport/golf/arti.title: LIV Golf: The silence from Europe is a growing issue for the sport
https://www.thetimes.com/sport/golf/arti.text: There was a time when Bryson DeChambeau was going to change golf all by himself. He won the US Open and hit the ball over canyons. He said he planned to live until he was 130 and play until rendered obsolete by 7ft-tall giants, but as three lonely Extinction Rebellion protesters held “blood golf” placards on Hemel Hempstead Road, the end of the American’s PGA Tour career provided a sign of shifting times.\nThe world No 28 has had blood on his hands in recent years from a flagellating training regime and has fallen from his 2020 zenith. Nevertheless, confirmation of his defection from the PGA Tour to the Saudi-backed LIV Golf Invitational Series was another noteworthy development on day two of the inaugural $25
image: Sergio García’s 2023 Ryder Cup participation in Rome remains in doubt
